Question: Hi Doctor, Saya disahkan mengandung anak ke-3. mengikut perkiraan, usia kandungan adalah 6-7 minggu. Masalah saya adalah pengalaman sebelum ini, yang mana melahirkan anak (ke-2) cleft lip. Sekarang berusia setahun 4 bulan dan masih menyusu badan. Persoalannya bole kah saya meneruskan penyusuan, bimbang memberi effect pada bayi dalam kandungan. seperkara lagi, bole kah saya ‘consume” asid folic lebih dari yang dicadangkan kerana bimbang anak dalam kandungan mengalami pengalaman yang sama. Harap dapat penjelasan. Answer: Saya sangat setuju untuk puan mengambil folic acid. Jika ambil sebelum mengandung lagi bagus. Untuk kebarangkalian anak seterusnya mendapat cleft lip apabila telah pun ada seorang anak yang cleft lip – peratusanya adalah antara 2- 8 peratus. Puan tidak patut hentikan penyusuan. Saya harap puan tidak terlalu gusar tentang hal ini, kerana kami mempunyai kepakaran yang boleh menolong puan dalam mengendalikan penyusuan anak dan juga pembedahan untuk membaiki cleft tersebut. Ia tidak berkaitan dengan perkembangan anak dan anak-anak puan, dengan berkat Tuhan, akan membesar seperti biasa dan normal.

Question: Hi doktor… Bayi saya berusia 5 bulan 25hari. 27.12.14 ni maka cukuplah 6 bulan. Apa yang merisaukan saya adalah bayi saya tidak buang air besar selama 12 harim kali terakhir adalahbpada 10.12.14 yg lepas… saya takut bayi saya sembelit. Saya menyusukan bayi secara ekslusif. (Susu badan). Setiap hari saya memang melakukan urutan pada seluruh badannya. Pada abdomen sy selalu buat “iloveu”. Tapi dia masih tidak membuang air besar sehingga kini… sy ada memberikn dia dua sudu kecil air kosong kerana terlalu risau.. tapi tetap sama… Bayi saya seorang yang aktif. Dia tidak banyak buat karenah dalam 12 hari ni… dan masih bermain dengan active. Adakah ini normal? Perlukah saya berjumpa dengan paed? Apa yang perlu saya lakukan? Tq Doktor.WEN.KL Answer: Air kosong tidak akan menolong bayi buang air besar. Sekiranya anak sihat, menyusu dengan baik dan tidak perut kembung, saya tidak akan terlalu risau. Namun, ada faedahnya untuk mendapatkan pemeriksaan dan kepastian daripada doktor pediatrik. Kemungkinan besar ini adalah berpunca daripada eksklusif breastfeeding di mana penyerapan dan pencernaan adalah mudah dan lembut.

Question: Dear doctors, my 3 month old baby BNO for 6/7. I was giving him breast milk and top up on and off with formula milk. Im not sure whether he is having constipation, should I bring him to see the doctor? He passed a lot of very odour flatus and no abdominal distension seen. Please give me some advices thank you. (Anna Lim) Answer: For exclusively breastfed babies, it is normal not to have passed motion for one week even. This is especially true if baby is otherwise comfortable, feeding well with no abdominal distension and no colic, no discomfort, and no vomitting. Does he have difficulty when he pass motion? Does he strain and is his stools very hard? If not the, it is highly likely there is nothing wrong. For mixed feeding, it may not be true but I suppose your baby is very much breastfed with very infrequent formula milk feeding. You can see a doctor to ensure baby is well, and the abdomen is not distended.

Question: assalamualaikum wbtb dan salam sejahtera, Sya berhajat utk menyusu penuh anak lelaki sya selama 2 tahun.Anak lelaki sya telah disahkan g6pd dan sya telah diberi penerangan dr hospital tentang penjagaan diri dan pemakanannya.Persoalan sya ialah 1) bagaimana pula dgn pemakanan sya, adakah sya juga perlu elakkan makanan2 spt supplement vit.C, kacang soya n etc.2) apa pendapat doc berkenaan dgn soy lecithin yg byk digunakan dlm chocolate dan kek? adakah ianya juga sbhgn ‘trigger g6pd’? (Izzaty) Answer: Hi Pn.Izzaty, Adalah lebih baik jika puan juga elak mengambil makanan yang akan mendatangkan komplikasi kepada pesakit g6pd. Ini kerana apa yang dimakan akan mempengaruhi kandungan susu ibu. Asalkan puan tidak makan dengan banyak, puan tidak perlu risau.

Question: Hi Doktor, Saya mempunyai seorang anak perempuan berusia 5 bulan. Dia sekarang amat gemar memasukkan jari dan lebih melampau lagi dia boleh memasukkan pergelangan tangan ke dalam mulut. Maka saya selalu pasti kan kuku dia sentiasa pendek. Apakah sebenarnya punca kepada tabiat ini?  Ada sesetengah pendapat mengatakan bahawa anak saya mahu makan solid food.. adakah pendapat ini benar? Minta pendapat doktor pula..  Terima kasih. (Nurul Anida) Answer: Ya, masuk tangan dalam mulut adalah normal, dan kelakuan biasa. Apabila sudah pandai mencapai objek, dia akan cuba mengenali benda ini dengan masuk ke mulut. Boleh cuba bagi solid food pada umur 6 bulan.

Question: Salam Sejahtera..Saya ingin bertanya adakah normal jika seorang bayi hanya naik 1 cm ukur lilit kepala setiap bulan?anak saya dilahirkan boderline prem @36w, berat 2.1kg, tinggi 51cm, coh 32cm..pada umur sebulan coh 33cm, berat 2.7kg, tinggi 52cm, umur 2 bulan coh 34cm, berat 3.4kg, tinggi 53cm..adakah anak saya mempunyai tanda2 microcephaly? Answer: Puan, kadar kenaikan lilitan kepala untuk bayi pramatang biasanya adalah 1 cm setiap minggu, tetapi semakin besar akan semakin perlahan. Secara umumnya, lilitan kepala akan bertambah 6cm dalam 3 bulan yang pertama. Maksudnya, dijangka akan bertambah daripada 32 cm ke 38cm pada umur 3 bulan. Daripada growth chart, lilitan kepala anak puan memang dibawah 3rd centile, maka ada kemungkinan adalah microcephaly. Perlu diperiksa dan dianalisa tentang perkembangannya. Sila rujuk kepada pakar pediatrik untuk pemeriksaan dan siasatan yang selanjutnya.

Question: Assalam Doktor, saya nak bertanya. Bayi saya berumur 10 bulan 3 minggu (lahir @ 37 weeks – 2.86kg). Setakat hari ini, dia masih belum boleh duduk. Dia pantas meniarap, bergolek dan ‘combat’ macam askar. Sudah ada ‘standing step’ apabila saya support. Ada cubaan mengangkat punggung. Cuma masih belum duduk. Minta nasihat doktor. Terima kasih. Answer: Puan, secara kasarnya bayi patut boleh duduk dengan kurang stabil pada umur 6 bulan dan boleh duduk tegak selepas 9 bulan. Ada yang sedikit lambat, namun harus dipastikan tiada masalah otot dan masalah saraf. Kemampuan untuk bergolek, meniarap dan crawl macam commando adalah tanda ada kemajuan dalam aspek gross motor. Perlu diperiksa kekuatan ototnya, spine, dan keseluruhan sebelum memberikan komen dan kesimpulan. Saya nasihatkan puan membawa anak untuk pemeriksaan sepenuhnya.

Question: hi doctor . baby saya berusia 35 hari, prolonged jaundice last check total bilirubin 10.5 mg/dL . doktor sahkan anak saya kurang sel darah merah HB 9.5 . doktor ada memberikan ubat seperti folic acid, appeton, FAC . adakah sesuai bayi seawal usia diberi ubat doktor ?Jika tidak diberikan ubat, apa kesannya kepada baby ? thank you. – shikin – Answer: Ubat tersebut boleh diberikan, malahan adalah ubat biasa untuk bayi lahir pramatang. Ada kemungkinan anak anda mengalamai physiological anaemia di mana Hb akan kembali normal apabila bayi lebih besar. Bayi perlu khasiat untuk membina sel darah merah yang sesuai, dan sekiranya anak tidak mempunyai masalah darah dan susu mencukupi. Ubat ini adalah supplement, tetapi bagi saya sumber khasiat utama masih adalah daripada susu. Jangan bagi air kosong, susu cair. Simptom anaemia adalah apabila anak kurang cergas, nampak pucat, dan lambat menyusu, nafas mungkin laju. Saya sarankan puan mendapatkan pemeriksaan daripada pakar pediatrik untuk pemeriksaan semula.

Question: Doktor..mengenai ubat suppositori pcm/doclofenac..adakah ubat tersebut sesuai utk d berikan pd kanak2 yg mengalami demam?? Sesetengah pihak tidak setuju dgn panggunaan supp dan ada sesetengah nye menggalakkan penggunaan supp.sy ingin mendapat nasihat dan pandangan doktor mengenai perkara ini…adakah supp selamat?? Bila masa yg sesuai untuk menggunakan supp?kekerapan penggunaan serta Kesan2 penggunaannye..terima kasih (nik faznieyah mat za) Answer: Suppositori paracetamol dan diclofenac memang digunakan untuk demam. Ubat suppository yang dimasukkan di bahagian dubur mempunyai kelebihan tindakan lebih cepat berbanding dengan ubat minum. Sekiranya kanak-kanak demam dengan suhu tinggi, adalah digalakkan untuk menggunakan suppository untuk menurunkan suhu kanak-kanak dengan lebih cepat. Oleh kerana ia juga merupakan ubat paracetamol, perlu diambil perhatian agar anak anda tidak terlebih dos paracetamol. Jumlah dos maksima paracetamol dalam sehari hendaklah diambil kira kedua-dua ubat supositori pcm dan ubat minum pcm. Adalah memadai sekiranya penggunaan pcm tidak melebihi 4 kali sehari (misalnya, sekali suppository dan tiga kali ubat minum). Ubat suppository juga boleh digunakan sekiranya anak anda enggan memakan ubat.

Question: salam doc…anak saya baru berusia 55 hari, dilahirkan normal,tiada sebarang masalah kesihatan dan bacaan kuning yang paling tinggi selepas bersalin adalah 10.7..selepas mandi pagi tadi saya perasan badan dia ada bintik2 merah yang tidak timbul…bayi saya tidak meragam dan menunjukkan tanda2 sakit. saya telah membawa dia berjumpa doktor dan apabila di periksa bayi saya tidak ada sebarang pendarahan di mulut dan gusi. dia juga tidak demam…doktor menyatakan ini terjadi disebabkan salur darah pecah. simptm yg dialami oleh bayi saya sy seolah2 org yg terkena demam denggi dimana terdapat bintik2 merah.. doktr tidak memberi sebarang ubat, cuma nasihat supaya meneruskan bf dan jika dalam masa seminggu bintik masih tidak berkurang atau bertamabah teruk sy perlu ke hospital dengan segera..soalan sy, masalah yang dihadapi oleh bayi sy berbahaya? adakah ia akan meninggalkan kesan dan apa jenis rawatan yang diperlukan? Answer: Nampaknya doktor berpendapat anak anda ada petechiae. Soalan saya adalah – adakah ia banyak sangat di seluruh badan? Sekiranya banyak petechiae, kami bimbang bilangan platelet darah adalah kurang maka sekiranya berleluasa dan tidak hilang, perlu check darah dan periksa semula lagi. Ada juga kadang ia adalah ruam lain yang seolah-oleh macam petechiae tetapi hanya reaksi kulit seperti alahan. Pecah salur darah yang kecil-kecilan pada kulit (petechiae) tidak bahaya,tiada kesan lama tetapi ia mungkin menggambarkan masalah beku darah, masalah pletelet rendah yang mungkin bahaya.

Question: My daughter is 9 years old.she cough more than 4 months and currently she is taking seretide. Is this medicine any side effect? (Michelle) Answer: Seretide is an inhaler consisting of steroids and long acting bronchodilator(medicine to open up the airways). With this use, the cough should be improving and if it is not, your doctor shold review this treatment. Seretide is not meant for long term use and should be downgraded to lower steroids or no steroids when her symptoms improve. Cough is a common feature of asthma, but there are also other cause for cough that should be considered by your doctor. Long term overdose use of steroids may cause side effects such as growth retardation, but if used within the normal limits and judiciously, the benefit of a good asthma control outweigh the side effects. If you have many doubts about Seretide, please discuss with your doctor for other options. Asthma treatment should follow a stepwise approach, in which when control of asthma is better, the strength of medicine should be reduced and eventually removed.

Boleh rujuk pada artikel ini untuk panduan https://www.doktorbudak.com/2013/07/18/anak-saya-tak-mahu-makan/ Selain daripada itu, melalui pengalaman saya, saya mendapati ramai kanak kanak yang minum banyak susu dan kerap sehinggakan mereka hanya kenyang dengan susu. Ini akan menyebabkan mereka kurang makan. Maka , susu perlulah dikurangkan secara berperingkat agar mereka tidak begitu kenyang sehinggakan tidak mahu makan dan terlalu bergantung pada susu. Ini adalah sesuatu yang mencabar pada peringkat awal kerana ramai ibu yang akhirnya akur dan memberi susu kerana anak menangis dan meronta ronta. Di sini perlunya kesabaran dan kreativiti. Satu lagi, cuba berikan makanan dahulu dan susu kemudian . Saya mengandaikan bahawa anak Puan tidak mempunyai masalah kesihatan yang lain. Question: Anak saya berumur 6 tahun, demam dengan suhu lebih kurang 39 darjah celc. Dia pernah 2-3 kali terkena sawan demam. Saya berikan dia paracetamol mengikut dos 5ml pada jam 7 petang. Malamnya dia terbangun dan tingkahlakunya seperti dia berhalusinasi (tergelak-gelak kecil dan kencing di atas karpet). Dia juga seperti keliru dan konfius. Tetapi suhu badannya ketika itu tidak panas. Lalu saya mandikan dia kemudian dia masuk tidur. Keesokkannya dia tidak ingat langsung tentang peristiwa itu.Soalan saya:1) Adakah paracetamol boleh menyebabkan halusinasi? Mengikut pengalaman, anak saya pernah berhalusinasi ketika suhu demamnya tinggi sahaja.2) Adakah paracetamol cuma menurunkan suhu luar badan sahaja? i.e, suhu dalam badannya masih panas.3) Adakah halusinasi ketika demam menyebabkan kesan jangka panjang kepada anak? Terima kasih. Answer: 1) Paracetamol tidak menyebabkan halusinasi, tetapi demam panas boleh, walaupun tidak rasa panas, kemungkinan suhu badan adalah tinggi. Ada juga ia adalah mimpi berjalan sahaja yang merupakan suatu sleeping disorder, tetapi jika tidak berulang lagi, encik tidak perlu risau. tetapi jika kelakuannya tetap tidak normal, perlu pastikan tiada jangkitan otak – meningitis/encephalitis 2) Paracetamol menurunkan suhu dalam badan. Tiada benda yang dipanggil suhu luar dan suhu dalam. Suhu badan ialah suhu badan. Dengan rasa melalui tangan adalah tidak tepat. Paracetamol akan cuba mengembalikan termostat dalam otak kepada suhu yang biasa. 3) Tiada jangka panjang sekiranya selepas itu tidak berulang lagi. Harus pastikan bukan meningitis ataupun encephalitis.

Question: Hi there.I am worried that my small girl having kind of blood clot beneath her right eye, since born. We already brought to few doctors however they said that it will disappear as she grows. Today she is 1year plus and the clot-kind keep increase in size. What it is actually and what should we do?Your advice and guide would be highly appreciated.Thank you. Answer: Dear AzYana, the explanation given might suggest that your child is having capillary hemangioma. It is one of the most common benign conditions of infancy. They characteristically have rapid growth in infancy (from 8-18 months) with spontaneous involution later in life. Since most of these lesions regress on their own, there is no need to intervene unless if there is systemic involvement like bleeding disorder or the lesion occlude her visual axis/ grows rapidly that cause reduced in vision/ eye protrusion. We suggest you to have a visit to an eye specialist for us to decide whether she needs to be observed or require medical intervention. Thank you.

Question: Anak saya berumur 6 bulan. Dia enggan disentuh oleh orang yang tidak dikenali. Ada yang mengatakan anak saya anti sosial apabila cuba ditegur atau diambil oleh orang lain dia akan menangis. Question: Hi, anak saya sudah 5 month plus. Masih boleh ambil rotavirus vaksin tak? (belle) Answer: Puan, this is the ACIP guideline on Rotavirus 1) Do not start the rotavirus vaccine series before 6 weeks of age. 2) Do not start the rotavirus vaccine series after a child has reached 14 weeks, 6 days. In other words, if the child is 15 weeks of age do not start the rotavirus series, because of insufficient data on the safety of the 1st dose in older infants. 3) Do not give any dose of rotavirus vaccine after a child reaches 8 months of age (8 months, 0 days) because of insufficient data on the safety and efficacy of the vaccine in infant

Question: hi doc,anak saya perempuan berumur 1tahun 2bulan. dia mempunyai masalah gross motor delay.sekarang dia hanya mampu meniarap dan sesekali angkat kepala atau punggungnya.dari segi fine motor adalah normal seperti kanak kanak seumur dengannya.dia lahir pada kndungan 36 minggu.spanjang kehamilan adalah normal saja.saya juga ada refer ke peads dan skarang followup dia cakera pemulihan cara kerja.setelah 3 bulan menjalani latihannya,dia masih tidak menunjukkan peningkatan. persoalannya,apakah diagnosis yang mungkin boleh di kaitkan dengan permasalahan anak saya dan bagaimana saya nak bantu dia untuk normal seperti kanak kanak lain.tq (nuraliya) Answer: Memang jelas anak anda ada kelewatan dari segi gross motor, dan memang bagus kerana telah pun mengambil langkah mendapatkan terapi carakerja/fisio dan pediatrik. Antara punca-punca utama kepada kelewatan ini adalh masalah otot, masalah saraf dan masalah dalam otak. Oleh itu, doktor pediatrik akan merancang untuk membuat ujian darah dan sisasatan lain untuk mendapatkan maklumat selanjutnya. Ada kemungkinan ia disebabkan oleh masalah yang boleh dirawat dan ada juga yang tidak dapat dirawat dan perlu bergantung kepada terapi fisio, carakerja yang rajin dan komited untuk menambahkan kemajuan dalam perkembangan gross motor. Saya nasihatkan puan untuk mendapatkan penjelasan yang rapi daripada pakar pediatrik anda kerana banyak maklumat diperlukan sebelum kami boleh memberikan prognosis dan jangkaan mengenai anak anda.

Question: Assalamualaikum doc, Saya ingin bertanya, apakah bakal ada sebarang masalah pada masa akan datang sekiranya anak saya jarang sekali sedawa setiap kali lepas menyusu? Anak sulung saya sudah hampir sebulan, setiap kali lepas menyusu, saya akan berusaha untuk sedawakan anak perempuan saya tapi jarang sekali berjaya. Sejak anak saya lahir bulan lepas, hanya 2 kali dia pernah sedawa. Saya juga perasan hampir setiap hari anak saya akan mengalami sedu. Kadang-kadang dalam sehari, 2-3 kali. Adakah kekerapan sedu disebabkan oleh kurangnya sedawa? Maaf kalau soalan saya agak kelihatan kurang bijak untuk ditanya. Saya baru bergelar ibu & kurang arif mengenai perihal budak. Saya risau melihat keadaan anak saya. Terima kasih sekiranya doktor sudi berikan jawapan kepada persoalan saya. Wasalam. (Ainul Mardhiah) Answer: Puan Ainul, soalan puan memang selalu ditanya. Sendawa :- (burping), ini penting untuk mengurangkan muntah dan refluks susu. Dengan membuang udara yang terperangkap dalam perut, ia akan mengurangkan kembung perut, muntah susu. Sekiranya jarang burp, bayi mungkin akan lebih mudah untuk muntah banyak dan menangis kerana kembung perut. Sedu:- Sekiranya tidak ganggu penyusuan dan tidurnya tidak perlu risau. Sedu/hiccup adalah mormal untuk bayi yang baru lahir. Ada banyak teori untuk mengurangkan sedu, tetapi saya tidak galakkan untuk guna cara menakutkan bayi, bagi air kosong dan menekan-nekan. Bagi masa dan ia akan hilang.

Question: Hi doc,As my water supply at my housing area not so clean so I bought reverse osmosis water filter.My baby now is 8 months old. Check with doctor , is this type of water suitable for my baby to drink? If not, can doctor explain why. And recommend what type of water filter suitable for baby. Secondly, I use the hot water without cooking from the water filter to mix with formula milk powder for my baby to drink. Is that ok for my baby to drink?  Thanks. (Ghim Sin) Answer: I do not agree that you do not boil the water because there could still be germs from the filter. We had seen cases before of babies getting serious infection from contaminated water. Reverse osmosis water is okay but you should still boil it, as we can not be sure of the source of the water.

Question: My girl 48 days. Get 2nd dose hep B at 1 month on her thigh. Her arm injection site started to inflammed after a week plus. Then, come out pus in green yellowish. She has no fever. Is this serious to bring to see doctor? Could i hand press to clear the pus? (Saw) Answer: Puan Saw, the swollen inflammation at the left arm is due to BCG vaccination given after 1 day of birth, and not Hep B as that is given at the thigh. BCG swelling with some pus discharge can be normal and need not require treatment unless there is surroudnuing skin infection or the abscess becoming larger. Please consult a doctor to confirm. Although the BCG injection is given at newborn period, it will only appear usually after 1 month.

Question: Doc, ank sy berusia 4 tahun. Dr segi perkembangan fizikal semuanya ok. Yg merisaukn sy ialah apabila bercakap dia akn tertukar baju n seluar, keluar n masuk, atas n bawah. Answer: Berkenaan dengan pergerakan seolah-olah otot kejang -> tidak boleh dikira sebagai sejenis sawan terutama sekali ia hanya berlaku semasa batuk selsema, dan tidak melibatkan hilang kesedaran. Question: Hi doc Anak saya berumur 6 bulan 15 hari. Lelak. Setakat ni dia boleh meniarap arah kanan sahaja dan tidak boleh melentang kembali. dia juga boleh membuat pusing tapi tidak boleh kedepan. Apakah saya perlu risau dengan perkembangan ini atau tunggu sahaja sampai dia mampu membuat gulingan dan bergerak kehadapan (Linda) Answer: Linda, Bayi 6 bulan biasanya mula meniarap dan akan mengambil masa untuk memusingkan badan semula. walaupun begitu, perkembangan bayi adalah berbeza tetapi dalam lingkungan umur yang sama jika normal. berikan sedikit masa dalam sebulan lagi seharusnya dia sudah boleh pada waktu itu. Sekiranya perkembangan lain ok, seperti mampu mengangkat kepala jika ditiarapkan , mampu memgimbang berat badan jika didirikan dan mencapai barang serta sudah mula nak berkata contoh bababa, maka ia tidak perlu dirisaukan

Question: Salam and hi. My son is currently 3 months old, was born full term via LSCS. He is active, breastfeeding and thriving well. I noticed that he has been having subcostal recession and suprasternal retraction since birth, however he is not tachypneic. The recession is not getting worse though. He also makes sounds (like he has much secretion) when he sleeps, but much improved currently. No cough or runny nose so far. Is that normal and would it resolve spontaneously as he grows up, or should I worry? Many thanks in advance. Answer: To be exactly sure, a paediatrician have to see in real life. While it is possible that there could be some mild subcostal recession that does not point to resp distress, we could not give assurance without proper assessment. The sound could result from some nasal snuffles which is normal. HIs sleep and feeding should not be affected though, and if it is then it indicates that you should do something about it.

Question: Good day Doctor, My son is 2 years 5 months now. As he is turning 3 this year both me and my husband decided to enrol him to a play-school and continued with the day-care.It has been four days and he cries non-stop untill I go to pick him up in the evening. Is this something normal?This is somehow disturbing me. Its very painful to see my lil one crying. The worse part is, he cried when we wanted to bring him out at night thinking we want to sent him to school. How can I help him to make him understand doc? ThanksMalar Answer: Hi Malar, Yes it is normal. He may not be ready for the whole day school/ daycare yet. He is not even three. Is he aware that he is going to school? The original concept of play school is based on playgroup where the children play with other children, with parents around sitting in the conner to observe them. If you feel that he really need to go to school at this age, I suggest you make enough preparation to help him to prepare for school. Both parents need to spend some time to talk to him about school, use lots of pictures, drawing or social stories of ‘going to school’. Visit the school with him, introduce him to the teachers and other kids. Perhaps this article can help https://www.doktorbudak.com/2013/12/07/anak-saya-menangis-bila-dihantar-ke-taska/ It can be quite frightening for a 19 months old to be left alone with ‘strangers’ at school. His reaction is normal. All the best!

Question: Salam & hi doctors. I have a 13 month old son. He used to know how to clap hands when he was 7 months old but now he just ignored when we asked him to clap hands or do anything. He will sometimes respond to us when his name is called.but when he is busy with something, he won’t respond. He doesnt know how to wave bye bye or pointing. Im worried. He is my first born staying with only me and husband while babysitter takes care of him during daytime. Is he showing symptoms of autism? Appreciate your reply. Thank you. (Nurul) Answer: HI Nurul, Are you sure he was able to clap hands at 7 months because that is not the normal age for clapping. What they do mostly at 7 months is transfer object from one hand to the other or bring their hands together and that is not considered clapping. clapping usually starts at about 12-13 months. It is normal not to respond if a kid is engrossed in something but if he does respond most of the time, then that is not a criteria of autism. May I suggest that you read the autism article on our website to have a clearer idea. What about his speech? What about his eye contact? You can go the website and type autism at the search button.

Question: Hi my name is ilyana and i just gave birth to my second baby few days ago. My baby is a G6PD baby and the paed at the hospital is keeping him for at least another 7 days for phototherapy treatment because of jaundice. They said because G6PD baby can easily get prolong jaundice. My question is, is it necessary to keep him under the phototherapy treatment for 7 days even though his reading is low? Answer: There is a standard protocol for G6PD observation in Malaysian setting. In Ministry of Health hospital setting, G6PD babies are kept for observation for the first 5 days, and will be given photo if the bilirubin level is above the photo level (the level may be adjusted to a lower threshold in view of the risk involved). If the reading is really low, much below the required photo level then no need. You should get assurance from a paediatrician who should be able to make good decision on G6PD cases. You should also be counselled about what are the do’s and dont’s of G6PD cases. G6PD can be a cause for high severe jaundice, and not exactly for prolonged jaundice although it may cause haemolysis later on and presented as prolonged jaundice.

Ketulan ini bergerak dn nmpk ketika anak sy memusingkan leher..sy telah membaca brjmp doktor pkar kanak- kanak Dan doktor tersebut menyatakn ianya ketulan brpunca dr jgkitan kuman..Dan akan hlg sndiri.. Dktr tersebut hanya melihat ketulan trsebut pd waktu itu tanpa ada rawatan.. Kini anak sy telah berumur 2 thn ketulan trsebut msh ada ttp tidak membesar.. Apa patut sy buat. Answer: Puan Nurul, itu adalah lymph node yang dapat dirasakan. Kerana anak masih kecil, kadang-kadang benjolan ini senang dirasai dan biasanya tidak bermakna apa-apa. Question: Dear Doctor, My baby will be 6mo on 09/12/14. She has been coughing with a lot of mucus in side her since 3 weeks ago. Last week, paed prescribe Salbumtamol and given nab. but its still not getting better.Last two days, she been coughing till vomit and we can see that her mucus is white colour. Today we brought her see the same paed again and she prescribe this Singulair 4mg to be taken once a day. My question is , whethere a 5-6mo baby can take this Singulair? My knowledge is that this medicine is for asthma patients to relieve the breathing. Is this medicine able to clear the mucus for the baby? is it safe? Wish to get reply from you soon. Thank you. Answer: Dear Winnie, when a paediatrician prescribe you a certain type of medicine, you have the right to question the doctor and get full information. I believe the paediatrician knows what she/he is doing if you doubt him/her, you should tell her. I agree with the doctor in using this for your child who may have prolonged coughing/wheezing from a viral infection. An infant would benefit from viral induced wheezing/hyperactive airway condition. It is still too early to label the infant to have asthma. It does not help much exactly in clearing mucus secretion but it may help to reduce further secretion. Montelukast is a leukotriene inhibitor and it works by suppressing the hypersensitivity/inflammation to reduce prolonged coughing and prevent further viral induced wheeze. I believe the paediatrician would NOT give you an unsafe medicine. If you have doubts, please tell the doctor that made the prescription. A good doctor-patient communication is important.

Question: Can a kid be given with paracetamol and diclofenac sodium at the same time? If so, what are the right dosage? Thanks. Answer: Diclofenac and paracetamol can be given at the same time for fever but it is not advisable to do so. The recommended NSAID for fever is ibuprofen, not diclofenac. Diclofenac is only given in suppository form when children have very high fever. Dosage is according to the weight of the child.

Question: My daughter is 11. She has a serious wet palm and feet issue. To the extend it affect her self esteem of shying away from shaking hands and unable to work normal as her feet is wet with water on slipper (the scene is like after washing her feet type) (Daniel) Answer: Hi Daniel, I can imagine the distress because that can cause serious impact on a teenager’s life. The condition is called hyperhidrosis and is treatable. You can bring her to visit the skin doctor at a dermatology clinic or hospital for iontophoresis. Improvement is seen after 5-6 sessions though. Meanwhile , there are measures that can be taken : 1. Avoid spicy food or food that generally cause her to sweat 2. use antiperspirant regularly 3. wear loose clothes 4. use mild soap However , I need to remind you that increased sweating may also be a sign of a medical condition called hyperthyroidism (increased in thyroid hormone)If she has the following sx, pls bring her to the paediatric doctor instead 1. eats a lot but thin 2. palpitations 3. diarrhoea 4. hand tremors 5. weight loss 6. fatigue 7. muscle weakness like difficulty to climb stairs 8. menstrual irregularities if she has had her menses 9. difficulty to sleep. Hope this helps.

Question: Assalam, Dear Dr. Zahilah, I need to ask you what is the best age for my dear daughter to start learning ABC,123 & alif ba ta.Now her age is almost 3 yrs old. Thanks Doc. Lianna. Answer: First of all, relax and don’t feel pressured. You can start teaching her if you see that she is ready, as in she likes to read and sit down and pay attention. Dont make it a stressful experience. Most importantly, at this age, she should display ability to understand your sentences, instructions and able to speak in phrases and short sentences. she can start reciting all the ABC but may take time to recognise the words. Make your learning activity as fun and enjoyable as possible.

Question: salam doc, saya mempunyai baby berusia 11bulan .pada usia 5bln saya dapati kepala ank saya teleng ke kanan.sy merujuk doc dan doc sah kan torticollis.sy sgt sush hati adakah rawatan fisioterapi utk torticollis menyakitkan utk baby.btw hr ni terpaksa membuat fisi utk pertama kali.sy sgt bimbang Answer: Torticollis pada peringkat bayi biasanya kerana posisi dalam rahim dan ada masalah bengkak dalam leher otot dan boleh pulih kerana fisioterapi dan tidak perlu rasa sakit hati kerana apabila dibuat dengan berhati-hati, ia tidak membawa rasa sakit. Anak mungkin tidak suka disentuh sebegitu tetapi bila menangis ia bukan kerana rasa amat sakit. Doktor perlu pastikan tiada masalah penglihatan dan masalah otot lain yang menyebabkan masalah ini.

Doktor, anak saya bertukar ke susu formula tetapi mengalami alahan sejak usia 4 bulan . Saya telah mencuba susu kambing dan soya tetapi masih mengalami masalah yang sama. Susu apakah yang patut saya berikan ? Aeisyah As salam Puan Aeisyah, Masalah alahan susu formula atau istilah perubatannya “Alahan Protein Susu Lembu” adalah masalah yang semakin kerap dilihat berlaku di kalangan bayi. Ianya kerap terjadi sewaktu bayi-bayi pertama kali dimulakan dengan susu formula samada sewaktu ibu mereka mula mencampurkan penyusuan dengan susu formula sebelum mereka mula berkerja selepas habis tempoh pantang atau bayi-bayi yang terus dimulakan dengan susu formula selepas dilahirkan. Simtom alahan yang ditunjukkan oleh bayi mungkin berbeza. Simtom alahan yang serius seperti sesak nafas, bengkak di bibir dan tepi mata serta ruam yang timbul beberapa minit sahaja selepas mengambil susu formula mungkin boleh terjadi. Ini jarang berlaku. Yang lebih kerap berlaku adalah manifestasi yang kurang serius dan berlaku beberapa jam atau dalam setengah-setengah pesakit beberapa hari selepas susu formula diambil. Antara simtom yang biasa dilihat adalah cirit birit, muntah, darah di dalam najis, sembelit dan ruam di kulit. Bayi yang mengalami masalah ini turut didapati gagal mencapai berat yang optima untuk tumbesaran. Walaupun simtom alahan biasa dilihat selepas mengambil susu formula, TETAPI ianya boleh dimanifestasikan oleh bayi yang menyusu badan sepenuhnya. Bagaimanakah ianya terjadi? Produk tenusu termasuklah susu lembu, krim dan seumpamanya yang diambil oleh ibu yang menyusu badan sudah tentunya mengandungi protein lembu dan sebahagian kecil daripada protein ini dikesan di dalam susu ibu dan amaun yang kecil ini sudah cukup untuk menyebabkan reaksi alahan kepada bayi. Merujuk kepada rawatan masalah ini, ianya adalah sangat mudah. Apa yang perlu dilakukan adalah memberhentikan susu formula yang mengandungi protein lembu di dalamnya. Umum mengetahui semua susu formula bayi adalah diproses dari bahan asas iaitu susu lembu. Jadi usaha menukar “jenama” susu sahaja adalah sia-sia. Pilihan yang ada tersenarai di bawah:   Penggunaan susu kambing adalah langkah yang kurang bijak kerana kajian telah menunjukkan yang 80% bayi yang dikenalpasti alah dengan protein susu lembu akan turut sama alah dengan protein susu kambing. Kebelakangan ini, kita telah melihat kehadiran susu formula berasaskan protein beras di pasaran. Tetapi pada masa ini, kesesuaian pilihan ini di dalam rawatan alahan protein susu lembu belum dipastikan dengan konkrit lagi. Untuk bayi yang mempunyai simtom alahan tetapi masih menyusu susu badan seratus peratus, ibu harus pantang daripada mengambil produk tenusu tetapi harus memastikan mengambil pil kalsium tambahan kerana produk tenusu adalah sumber utama kalsium. Harus di ingat yang pilihan di atas perlu ditentukan oleh doktor pakar yang biasa merawat masalah ini. Ibu-ibu tidak seharusnya membuat keputusan sendiri tanpa pengawasan doktor pakar kerana terdapat kes yang disyaki menghadapi alahan tetapi simtom yang dialami disebabkan oleh masalah kesihatan yang lain. Ini penting kerana doktor yang merawat mungkin akan menjalankan penyiasatan lain jika perlu. Question: Anak saya berusia 5 tahun, baru sahaja berkhatan mengunakan khidmat tok mudim. boleh x saya tahu, berapa hari anak saya akan sembuh? Answer: Kadar sembuh boleh berlainan mengikut individu dan mengikut umur, tetapi biasanya antara 7-10 hari. Ada juga yang mengambil 2-3 minggu.

The first thing that struck me whilst in Gaza, was how young people were everywhere. Over half of the population in Gaza is under 18 years old, making it one of the youngest populations in the world. I clearly remember seeing kids, literally, just everywhere I went. They were running around in the streets, chasing each other; building structures with sand by construction sites, and they were bending in circles, playing marbles around their residences. By their concentration and cries of excitement each time a boy’s carefully selected marble struck a score, I figured that this was their favourite game. I was told they play it a lot during winter. Thus it would seem only logical to guess that during any military incursion, children would be heavily affected. During the recent 51-day Israeli assault on the Gaza Strip, 501 out of the 1,473 Palestinian civilians killed were children. More than 3,000 children were injured, 54,000 were left homeless, and 1,500 were orphaned. A single dead Israeli child is a tragedy but 501 dead Palestinian children is just a statistic. Every single child is precious and the genocide has deprived 501 children of their right to live like any other child and families of their sons and daughters. Let us try to begin to understand what it means to grow up as a child in Gaza. Playing by the beach means risking your life I was also told that the beach was a favourite vacation spot for Gazans. It was a therapeutic escape from the harsh realities of the blockade. That was until the beach too became a dangerous place. Zakaria Ahed Bakr, 10, Ahed Atef Bakr, 10, Mohammed Ramez Bakr, 11, and Ismail Mohammed Bakr, 9 were playing soccer by the beach, and were shot mercilessly by Israeli missiles during the most recent massacre. If even the beach is no longer a safe place for kids to have fun and play, where else?  Doing homework in the dark is a norm The electricity crisis has hit Gaza since 2006. Most of the households receive about 12 hours of electricity per day at most. Those 12 hours are considered a luxury. The unfortunate households typically get only up to 6 hours of electricity per day. Their everyday lives have to be adjusted according to the electricity schedule. I visited one of our family friend’s house in Gaza, I saw kids doing their homework with the lights from the solar lamps which Viva Palestina Malaysia donated a couple of years back. It brought a smile upon my face. A friend’s child was trying to explain to me in Arabic, with the help of some sign language, how she preferred a particular type of solar lamp as it was brighter for her; hence, she was able to study better. When I was younger, I can recall using ‘no electricity’ as an excuse not to complete my homework. Drinking water may kill too More than 90 percent of the water in Gaza was declared as being too contaminated for drinking purposes by several UN Agencies. Gaza‘s sole water source is chemically contaminated with dangerous levels of chlorides, nitrates and other pollutants, some far in excess of WHO guidelines. Infants and young children are especially physically vulnerable to the immediate effects of microbiological contamination, which are diarrhoea and vomiting that will then lead to dehydration.  Going back to school is a reminder of bombings and destruction Twenty-six schools were completely destroyed. And hundreds were damaged during the recent aggression, Many UNRWA schools served as temporary shelters for more than 55,000 displaced persons. All of the 474,000 school going children and 55,003 kindergarten-aged children were deprived of any form of education, as schools and pre-school facilities were unable to open on their scheduled date. When they were finally able to go back to school, they were met with the brutal scars of the aggression – shattered window glasses, large holes on the walls, shattered surrounding buildings, ruined playgrounds, dead school mates, and much more. When I was in Gaza in 2013, I personally visited 11 schools to audit our VPM project of rehabilitation of schools in North Gaza that were affected by the war in 2009. It was the warmest feeling ever, seeing the smiles of the school children enjoying their newly refurbished schools and their new laboratories, libraries and sports facilities. Being an eight-year-old in Gaza means you have witnessed at least three wars in your life Psychologically, that is very disturbing. Disturbing is actually an understatement. It could be indeed detrimental to one’s mental health. The intense psychosocial stress caused by violence has deeply affected the children and at least 373,000 have already been identified as suffering from Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) and are in need of psychosocial support. Death, injury and homelessness have created a population of orphans, children with disabilities and children in need of child protection services. In addition, child abuse amongst the displaced persons has also become increasingly prevalent as a result of overcrowding and lack of privacy in shelters – a situation that raises the potential for children’s exposure to violence, abuse and neglect. Going to the hospital for treatment, may also lead to death A one-day attachment at a children’s hospital in Gaza was a most revealing experience and it motivated me to work even harder to help this extremely vulnerable population. Many of the patients could only be managed with supportive and palliative care, as definitive treatment was not available. Many drugs, surgical appliances, disposables and medical equipment were either scarce or simply unavailable. A baby that is born with a congenital malformation and requires urgent surgery will need to be transferred to Israeli hospitals. This would incur a high expense which many Gazan families could ill afford. Others might opt to transfer to a cheaper alternative in Egypt which is, however, hampered by the blockade at the Rafah crossings. The children of Gaza are deprived of their basic human right of access to a safe and appropriate health care facility. Poverty, food insecurity, insufficient micronutrient supplementation are among the factors contributing to chronic malnutrition among children. Based on Ard El Insan (AEI) project statistics of the last 3 years (2011-2013), the prevalence of severe and moderate anemia among children under 5 was 29.4 percent. 8.6 per cent of children under five were identified as wasted and 14.6 per cent were identified as growth faltering cases. These micronutrient deficiencies, or also called “hidden hunger”, can cause serious and irreversible cognitive and developmental deficits, especially amongst young children  But, to live is also to hope The face of a pretty 8-year-old girl I met at the hospital was playing in my subconscience while I’m writing this piece. She had just undergone a major surgery to remove a large mass from her abdomen that could possibly be a tumour. Despite that, she was still able to smile when I spoke to her and gave her a few personal gifts. The smile on her face really showed how these innocent children do not harbour any form of hate but simply yearned for a playful and enjoyable life, a childhood safe and protected from the atrocities and brutalities of the games adults play. This little, and beautiful soul taught me to be brave, resilient and to smile in the face of adversity. Her beautiful smiling face will forever be etched in my memory bank and will be my inspiration to continue to serve the cause of these most unfortunate children of Gaza. How can you help? After her mission to Gaza in 2012, she published a book ‘Remember Us’ as part of the project of the Friendship Committee of Viva Palestina Malaysia, where she co-edited and contributed four stories. www.rememberusstories.com.

Question: My girl is 23 months old now & under the day & night care by nanny (except weekend with Parents), every time when she about to poo (or other action), we try to clean her, initially she reluctant to clean(say no… don’t want. When we observed her request not to clean her, she will cry & ask otherwise..(mean she want to clean now). She will acting the same ways for other actions like feed her lunch, …etc. Doctor, any communication with this attitude or she just ask for pacifying? Thank you Doctor. (Edward Wong) Answer: She is trying to communicate with you with the only way she know how, as a 23 months old girl. When she say ‘No’, do not stop there, find out what she actually meant. Talk to her, use simple language appropriate to her age. She probably just want to play with you. She probably feels unfamiliar with you, having seeing you only on weekends. Get to know her, make her feel comfortable and safe with you. All the best. Replied by Dr Norharlina Bakar (For more enquiries on related matter, please direct question to ‘Parenting/Psychology’ column. Thank you.)

“Hafiz is more naughty than My older son, Razi , he is always getting into trouble at school and does not take his schoolwork seriously. Hafiz is also easygoing and has many friends so he often gets into mischief. However, he has his own mind, confident and more independent than Razi “ Usually this is how parents talk about their second child; it’s becoming a common thing you hear. The arrival of a second child be it planned or unplanned is usually celebrated with less fanfare and excitement as the first child arrival. This is because most parents feel that they have been through the situation and the experience is nothing new. As such parents tend to neglect the emotional and mental needs of the second child. Does birth order really affect an individual? Yes it does as shown by research of Alfred Adler. Birth order often can leave an indelible impression on the individual’s style of life, which is a habitual way of dealing with the tasks of friendship, love, and work. Other birth order factors that should be considered are: the spacing in years between siblings; the total number of children; and the changing circumstances of the parents over time. According to Adler the second or middle child often have sense of not belonging, they fight to receive attention from parents and they feel insecure easily. The middle child or second child lacks drive and actually looks for direction from the first child. They tend to go with the flow of things. Adler also describes them as a natural mediator and is usually the peacemaker in the family. They would have many friends due to their easygoing nature and is loyal to their friends. The child may have even temper or take it or leave attitude. Adler believes that the middle child feels squeezed out of a position of privilege and significance. As such they are compelled internally to find peace within the family. As such the younger sibling would learn the rule of the game as they acknowledge the power of the first child. The second child quickly and develop different personalities from their older sibling. Hence the first and second child pattern of behavior seems to be polar opposites (Silverman 1988). Cornell (1984) did a study and found that found that second born children who are recognized as being gifted are better adjusted than second born who are not recognized. The child is described as more emotionally stable, more controlled, less tense or frustrated, less anxious and neurotic. Parents even described them as being better adjusted than the first child. In summary second born are described as being more flexible or cooperative yet competitive. They are calmer, generous, some more rebellious, adventurous and easygoing. They are peacemaker and strong negotiators, however they are more secretive than first born as they are used to being independent. If you are a second born you are in good company as Martin Luther King, Abraham Lincoln, Princess Diana to name a few are second born. As parents and educators it is important to identify each child as different individuals. The relationship with each child should be established and separate. Parents should not compare their children because this would instigate the child to behave otherwise. As parents you would have difficulty getting through your second child at times. You find that they build walls around them which are negative attitude or sarcasm, be patient and break these walls down with kindness, affection and love. They may not respond to your affections because they want to make parents feel guilty about not spending enough attention to them. Don’t be demotivated , they actually cherish the attention that you give them. They would also tend to get into trouble as a form of seeking attention, try not to reprimand them all the time. Instead try to discipline them via positive reinforcements and reward good behavior. As a second child they may be used to the ignorance they faced earlier on, some may not be ambitious as they feel their efforts won’t be recognized. Parents should utilize positive reinforcement and praise each child to acknowledge their presence and make them feel special. “There is in every child at every stage a new miracle of vigorous unfolding “ Erik Erikson (Pic source: www.goodnightsleepsite.com) Dr. Nazariah Aiza Harun is a Psychiatrist at a government hospital. She is currently attached to Hospital Sultan Abdul Halim, Sungai Petani, Kedah. She attained her Doctor of Medicine (MD) from UPM and went to UM for postgraduate studies in Master of Psychological Medicine. She is currently undergoing her subspecialty training in Child and Adolescent Psychiatry.

(ahboimummy) Answer: Dear mummy, please read this article :- https://www.doktorbudak.com/2013/07/19/adakah-warna-najis-anak-saya-normal/ Basically, the change in colour could be due to change in transit time, interaction of the milk substrate with the gut bacteria populaiton. Question: Bayi yg mendapat vaksin hep b pada waktu lahir,1 bulan dan 6 bulan diberi vaksin hexaxim pada usia 2,3 dan 5 bulan.Adakah ini akan menyebabkan masalah overvaccination kerana bayi itu telah menerima 6 suntikan vaksin hep b secara keseluruhan? (Mohd) Answer: Encik, adalah jarang ini berlaku dan tidak banyak pengalaman mengenai hal ini. Namun, suntikan Hep B adalah suatu suntikan yang selamat dan jarang menyebabkan kesan sampingan, di mana ada segelintir kecil yang mungkin demam sekejap. Namun, memang tidak perlu begitu banyak kali vaksin Hep B. Untuk Hexaxim, pihak supplier ada menyarankan untuk memberikan Hexaxim pada bulan 2, 4, 6 di mana pada bulan pertama tidak diberi 2nd dose Hep B.

Question: Dear Doctors, I have a 2 1/2 year old son. For the past month, I have noticed that my son has a lack interest in playing, whether with his toys or at the playground. He seems to be bored. His toys are inclusive of animal figurines, building blocks, puzzles, model vehicles etc. When I brought him to the playground, we only spend around 15-20 minutes before he asked to go home. What cause this issue? Should I get new toys, bring him to a more crowded playground? Thank you. (Cool Dad) Answer: Dear Sir, Does he have good eye contact with you and others? How does he communicate? How does he tell you that he wants to go home? Children at this age are usually fond of playing, so I would like to first exclude and social behavior that could be abnormal. If he is already picking up words and phrases, has good eye contact, then I wont be too worred. Otherwise, he needs a check-up. I agree that new toys, friends will motivate him to play more. It is possible that he is really bored. Is his lack of interest something new or he has been like this since the beginning ? If this has just recently happened, then it could be due to some recent events, or an illnes. We hope to get our pyschiatrist to give further answer on this.

Question: Hi..anak saya berumur 2 bulan…2-3 hari lalu baru perasan ada benjolan di sebelah kiri bawah ketiak anak saya….adakah itu lumph node?anak sy tidak ada demam dan feeding semua ok…benjolan tu dlm ukuran 2×1 cm,setakat ini semua vaksin lengkap dan megikut jadual,jadi perlu kah dirawat or dibiarkan dulu ?Sekian terima kasih. (Shafiq Shahmi) Answer: Hi Syafiq, kemungkinan besar masalahnya ialah BCG lymphadenitis, ia adalah kesan dari suntikan BCG semasa lahir yang menyebabkan kelenjar ketiak kiri membengkak. Kebiasaannya, ia akan mengecil dan pulih dengan sendiri sekiranya ia tidak merah atau bernanah. Namun , saya menggalakkan agar pemeriksaan dilakukan oleh doktor dan dipantau sehingga hilang.

Question: I was prescribed Altacef-250 due to blocked duct on my breast and was informed that it is safe for breastfeeding. However, i found few articles online saying that this antibiotic is not safe for breastfeeding. Can i continue to breastfeed after taking the medicine? i wish to stop taking it as my blocked duct has gone. (Shibi) Answer: Cefuroxime is safe to be used for breastfeeding moms. What are the articles and is the conclusion well defined ? There are only very few medications that are truly unsafe and totally unacceptable to be used during breastfeeding. If you are concerned, you can opt to discard the milk that is produced for the next 3-4 hours after taking the medicine. Of course, you should also question if you should take the medicine, to see if it is really indicated. While Cefuroxime taken in the right dose should not cause significant harm, one should not take medicine unncessarily. As cefuroxime is an antibiotic, it should be used for treating an infection. I am not sure of its use for blocked duct unless there is element of infection.

Question: My kid is 2 years old. He teeth got a lot of black stain.It is hard to brush it off, unless I use my finger to “scrape” the teeth, then only i can remove the black stain. But, after few days, the stain comes back again. (He doesn’t like to brush his teeth, it is hard for us to help him brush properly) Answer: Dear Diana, Staining of teeth occur for a variety of reasons. Most often staining is extrinsic (external) in nature and typically due to food colour and is easily removed with brushing. The dark stains you described for your child is most likely due to Chromogenic staining. This condition is due to colonisation by a group of black or brown bacteria species that have preference for teeth particularly along gum margins. The condition is harmless but can be rather unaesthetic as it gives the appearance of ‘dirty’ teeth. Surprisingly, black chromogenic staining occurs in clean mouths. Other forms chromogenic staining by coloured bacteria include yellow or green types found in those with poor oral hygiene. Most children with black chromogenic staining improve over time as oral balance becomes established. Invariably, professional cleaning may be necessary when the staining becomes adherent or persistent. Your child can be introduced to your family dentist for introductory dental care, and when your child is able to cooperate for simple tooth polishing, then removal of the black staining can be effectively carried out. Often a few treatment sessions may be necessary as the chromogenic bacteria tends to recolonize after sometime.

Question: My boy is 9 months old, i found that he has lesser urine passing recently. His diaper is dry from 7pm until 12am..he drank 1-2 times milk around 4oz. But still dry diaper. But he still can pee normally while sleeping at nite. The urine color is pale yellow and he is active as usual. Appreciate your advise. Thanks. (Jessie) Answer: Hi Jessie, is this a daily occurrence? As your child has started eating , he is likely to drink less than he did when he was less than 6 months old. It is expected that he passes urine if he drank 4 oz of milk . If he is well, active , passes a lot of urine at other times, no distended abdomen _ I would think that it is not worrying , HOWEVER , I would need to know how many times he drinks and passes urine in 24 hours. As much as I would like to reassure you , this is difficult without knowing the full details of his urine output frequency.

Question: Hi doctor, my son is aged 1yr3m, weight at 7.5kg (premature 31/52 born weight 1kg) growth and weight has been delayed. My son got a problem since born – bilateral undescended testis. Need to know is it my son suitable to do operation right now due to the weight is out of the growth chart. (Stephanie) Answer: Dear Stephanie, it is expected that premature baby can have bilateral undescended testes, which usually will descend with time. Usually at least by 1 year of age, your child should be referred to the surgeon for evaluation and surgery if it still has not descended. . It is important that you get your child examined and seen if the testes have / have not defended. If there is no other risk factor, the weight should not be a problem as it is considered a minor surgery.

Question: Umur saya 15 tahun . Saya x tahu kalau saya masih dikira budak tapi saya masih nak tanya . Saya susah nak tidur start masa saya umur 14 tahun masa cuti sek sampai sekarang saya terpaksa ambil ubat xanex . Sekarang saya berumur 15 tahun . Sakit saya menjadi lebih teruk semasa periksa pt3 hendak bermula . Disitu dr nasir dari klinik saya mensyorkan saya untuk berjumpa dengan dr pakar . Jadi dr pakar memberi saya lexapro dan ubat itu bertindak dengan baik selepas exam dan apabila ubat itu habis saya sambung xanex kerana takut tidak boleh tidur kerana dr ketika itu tiada jadi saya x boleh ambil ubat jadi bila jumpa dgn dr tu balik . Dr tu ckp sambung lexapro dan berhenti xanex dan selepas itu saya terus ambil lexapro dan saya rasa anxiety dan sukar untuk tidur sekarang ni . Tapi dr dan ibu saya tidak beri saya sambunh xanex kerana akan slow kan saya punya memory jadi saya ingin tanya ubat apa yang sepatutnyaSaya ambil? (Liyana) Answer: Hi Liyana, Lexapro adalah ubat yng perlu diambil secara berterusan mengikut nasihat doktor. Tidak digalakkan mengambil ubat xanax secara berterusan tanpa dipantau oleh doktor kerana xanax boleh memberi kesan ketagihan. Saya cadangkan Liyana jumpa semula doktor dan berbincang mengenai masalah Liyana kerana mungkin Liyana perlukan tambahan dose atau ubat yang lain memandangkan Lexapro dose yang sama tidak memberi kesan.

Question: My son have a 7 months old with microtia & atresia on his left ear.Could anyone give me details of microtia and what they have gone through. I wish to know which are the hospital have doing specialized surgeries on microtia & atresia.I felt very depressed. Thanks. (Fanny) Answer: Dear Puan, Is your son under a paediatrician follow-up and ENT doctor follow-up? They are the best person to advise you as they know the exact problem and the features, as each individual’s problem is unique. If he is not under anyone’s care, then I would like to suggest you to approach a doctor either in the private or govt clinic, to request for a referral to the most suitable paediatric and ENT centre. Please read this article which can give you an idea – http://www.microtia.net/dealing.htm I will get our ENT doctor to answer more on this.

Question: Anak saya berusia 11 bulan baru dihantar ke pusat asuhan kanak – kanak. Semenjak dia dihantar, dia kerap demam. Saya tahu anak – anak yang selsema batuk tetap dihantar ke pusat asuhan maklumlah ibu bapa bekerja mungkin tidak dapat bercuti lama untuk menjaga anak – anak yang tidak sihat. Jika anak – anak demam tetapi aktif, mereka tetap menghantar anak – anak. Masalahnya, anak saya kerap menghidap demam sekitar selang 2 ke 3 minggu. Saya cuba untuk tidak memberi antibiotik tetapi, anak saya demam sehingga 39 ke 40’c dan saya terpaksa membawa anak ke klinik jika berlarutan sehingga 3 hari. Kebiasaannya doktor akan memberikan antibiotik selepas ujian darah jika perlu. Sesetengah doktor terus memberikan antibiotik apabila jangkitan tonsil. Saya seperti tidak punya pilihan selain menghabiskan dos antibiotik yang ditentukan. Adakah cara saya menguruskan demam anak saya betul? Saya takut terlalu kerap memberikan antibiotik mendatangkan masalah kepada anak saya. Saya juga ingin tahu apa yang boleh saya lakukan untuk meningkatkan antibodi anak saya. Dia menyusu eksklusif selama 8 bulan dan masih menyusu sehingga kini. Adakah perkara ini berlaku kerana anak saya baru dihantar ke pusat asuhan dan keadaannya akan bertambah baik selepas beberapa bulan. (Farhana) Answer: Farhana, Kami tidak menggalakkan anda untuk membuat keputusan bertentangan dengan arahan doktor sekiranya anak telahpun diperiksa. Namun , adalah penting untuk berbincang dengan doktor yang merawat samada jangkitan adalah kuman yang kemungkinan virus atau bakteria. Kuman virus kerap menjangkiti kanak kanak dan boleh menyebabkan demam tinggi. Lihat pada simptom lain- batuk , selsema, sakit tekak ( mungkin dari tekak hingga salur pernafasan ), muntah , cirit birit ( dari usus) contohnya. Namun jika ianya ringan , anak aktif , boleh makan dan minum walaupun sedikit terjejas maka itu kemungkinan sekali jangkitan virus dan tidak memerlukan antibiotik. Maka penjagaannya lebih pada mengawal demam dan untuk kuman virus , ia mengambil masa beberapa hari untuk pulih sendiri dlm 3-5 hari.Ubat demam boleh diberikan setiap 6 jam dirumah. Jadi jika simptomnya ringan tapi demam masih tinggi, dan tidak reda dan masih berulang dengan ubat demam, maka pada hari ketiga boleh berjumpa dengan doktor untuk pemeriksaan darah . Namun , jika ada sukar bernafas , nafas berbunyi atau nafas laju, ia mungkin jangkitan yang lebih serius. Ia boleh jadi virus ataupun bakteria maka ini memerlukan antibiotik jika kumannya bakteria. Ini akan ditentukan oleh doktor yang memeriksa. Jadi adalah penting untuk mengenalpasti bilakanh anak anak boleh dirawat di rumat dan bila pentingnya membawa berjumpa doktor. Topik ini telah diterangkan dengan mendalam dalam beberapa artikel kami sebelum ini. Puan boleh rujuk ke search button – dan taip demam , antibiotik . Penerangan lanjut ada di situ.

Question: Hi doktor budak..bayi saya berusia 16 hari dan disahkan prolonged jaundice dengan bacaan latest 13..ujian air kencing menunjukkan bayi saya mempunyai kencing kotor dan diberikan antibiotik..soalan saya: Terima kasih. (hamidah Answer: HI Hamidah. Kencing kotor boleh disebabkan oleh kuman dalam darah yang merebak ke air kencing ataupun disebabkan oleh masalah pada saluran kencing, Ia perlu dirawat dengan antibiotik kerana antibodi pada bayi tidak cukup kuat untuk melawan jangkitan tersebut. Kebiasaannya bayi kelihatan sihat sahaja selain kuning pada awalnya, namun jika tidak dirawat dengan antibiotik kuman boleh membiak dan bayi mula kelihatan sakit. Ia merbahaya jika TIDAK dirawat. . Jika dirawat dengan antibiotik yang betul, ia lagi tidak merbahaya. Selepas dirawat , satu ultrasound scan ( sama seperti scan untuk ibu semasa mengandung) akan dilakukan untuk melihat struktur pada sistem dan saluran kencing. Bergantung kepada keputusan tersebut , doktor anak anda akan menasihati selanjutnya.

Question: Assalamualaikum dan salam sejahtera doktor.. Bayi saya berumur 3 bulan dan terdapat tompok2 pada abdomen,kaki dan tangannya. Kadangkala tompok2 tersebut akan menjadi sangat merah dan bayi saya kelihatan kurang selesa,jika tidak ianya kelihatan bewarna putih seakan2 panau. Saya membawanya ke klinik dan doktor mengesahkan yang ianya alergik dan doktor memberikan krim untuk disapu dan 2 jenis ubat minum,untuk siang dan malam, 2ml sekali minum. Saya nak tanya, adakah ubat minum ini sesuai dan selamat untuk diberikan pada bayi saya memandangkan usianya yang masih sangat muda. Terima kasih. (Nurul Aqilah Abdulla) Answer: Puan, sekiranya allergi itu tidak terlalu teruk, maka lebih baik guna ubat sapu sahaja. Ubat seperti steroid boleh diterima tetapi ubat antihistamin seperti chlorpheniramine, cetirizine adalah kurang sesuai. Sekiranya berlaku mata, mulut bengkak, susah nafas, nafas berbunyi – ini perlu dibawa ke hospital segera. Yang penting juga ialah kenal pastikan apakah agen/faktor yang menyebabkan alahan ini.

Question: Hi doc! My one year son has been diagnosed with anemia due to lack of iron and folic acid. Currently he has to take folic acid syrup and iron on daily basis. It is such an unpleasant experience that I have to force him to take the supplements. I would like to know the suitable diet for my son to help increase his red blood level. Thanks. (Ila) Answer: Puan Ila, you can refer to the list of food that are rich in iron and folic acid nutrients, and encourage good eating habit. The supplements are merely a short term solution, and eventually, a good diet is the key to preventing anaemia. Iron: nuts, beef, lamb and other meat, beans, whole grains, dark leafy greens (spinach), liver Folic acid: beans and peas; dark green vegetables such as broccoli, spinach, collard or turnip greens, okra, and asparagus; and citrus fruit and juice. (source from other nutrition website )

Question: Tuan doktor saya mempunyai anak perempuan yang berusia 3 tahun 7 buan.Berat badan lebih kurang 15kg dan tinggi 95 cm. Pada 25/10/2014 dia telah mengalami masalah cirit birit dan muntah yang teruk. Saya mengambil langkah untuk memberhentikan sementara minum susu formula dan semua jenis makanan dan minuman yang mempunyai sumber susu dan coklat. Selepas 2 minggu dia tidak lagi mengalami masalah tersebut dan saya meneruskan pemberian susu formula, malangnya setiap kali minum susu dia akan ciri birit dan najis berwarna kuning yang cair. Pada 4/11/2014 saya telah memabawa dia ke klinik dan doctor menyarankan untuk sementara bertukar kepada susu tanpa laktosa. Saya memberikn dia susu isomil susu soya tanpa laktosa lebih kurang 2 minggu,semanjang dia minum susu tersebut tidak mengalami cirit birit,cuma kadang kala najis beliau berwarna hijau dan mempunyai lendir.Pada 18/11/2014 saya cuba untuk memberi susu formula biasa kepada dia, malangnya dia kembali mengalami masalah cirit birit. Untuk makluman doktor sepanjang dia mengalami cirit birit dan diberhentikan sementara susu serta minum susu tanpa laktosa dia seorang yang aktif dan makan serta minum seperti biasa dan tidak mengalami demam.Mohon doktor memberikan penjelasan..terima kasih. (Fazilah) Answer: Nampaknya anak anda mempunyai masalah post-enteritis lactose intolerance. Biasanya ia akan pulih selepas beberapa minggu. Saya nasihatkan cuba lagi selepas sebulan lagi. Tidak dijangka akan mempunyai masalah berterusan sehingga jadi sesuatu yang kronik. Apabila mengalami gastroenteritis di mana peradangan berlaku pada usus, akan terhakis lapisan vilus-vilus yang bertugas menyerap laktosa, maka akan terjadi tidak toleran kepada laktosa dan menyebabkan cirit.

Question: Bolehkah anak sy yg berusia setahun 1 bulan mengambil suntikan mmr sedangkan dia sedang mengambil antibiotik dan baru di sahaja di x-ray bbrp hari yg lalu. Bolehkah sy melewatkan suntikan mmr anak sy sebelum umurnya 18 bulan. (Fara Maya) Answer: X Ray tidak menggangu apa-apa. Suntikan vaksin tidak patut diberi semasa ada demam. Selsema sedikit tidak perlu risau, dan antibiotik tidak dikenalpasti sebagai sebab untuk tidak diberi vaksin. Namun, sekiranya anak belum pulih daripada penyakit yang menyebabkan anak perlu antibiotik, maka lebih baik tunda. Suntikan harus diberikan pada umur 12 bulan. Boleh lewat sedikit. Sila baca artikel ini : https://www.doktorbudak.com/2013/08/29/399/

Question: Terima kasih doktor kerana telah memberi respon kpd soalan saya sebelum ini… Saya masih ada masalah mengenai anak lelaki saya berumur 3 tahun lebih… Anak saya minum susu formula dan sangat susah nak makan,jika dia nak makan pun hanya telur dan biskut sahaja.. Lain2 dia akan tolak walau bermacam cara telah saya lakukan.. Masalah nya anak saya buang air besar setiap hari,jika dia kerap minum susu dalam satu hari dia akan buang air besar 3 ke 4 kali,dan warna najis ny gelap,kadang2w kuning dan agk berbau serta cair… Anak saya minum susu dutch lady 123 perisa biasa.. Adakah anak saya mengalami apa2 masalah percernaan atau sebagai nya… Harap doktor dapat membantu… Terima kasih. (Pn. Ayu) Answer: Masalah begini mungkin berkaitan dengan gastro-colic reflex ( refleks yang normal di mana selepas perut dipenuhi akan menyebabkan rasa ingin buang najis), irritable bowel syndrome ataupun lactose intolerance. Perlu pemeriksaan selanjutnya oleh doktor dan analisa najis mungkin boleh membantu. Sekiranya berlaku susut berat badan dan sakit perut, hal ini perlu dirujuk segera.

Question: My 6 years old daughter complaining lower back pain after practicing gymrama at home.She seems like not to worry me because she said it will be fine after rest. I ask her to lie on a flat bed and try to raise the each side of the leg. She said it’s pain when raise the left leg. But after 10 minutes, she fall asleep. Is she really ok? Answer: If your child has backpain and has pain after raising her leg , it is wise to go and see an orthopaedic doctor for further examination . They would be able to do further examination to see if there is a need for any further investigation to rule out spine problems. Backpain shd be taken seriously. Hopefully it is nothing serious but do bring her to see a doctor.

Question: Dear Doctor,My baby is 6 months++ old. He started solid food 2 weeks ago. He drinks formula milk during day time and I will breastfeed him at night. He has no bowel movement for 5 days now, but he is fine (no fever, tummy is soft, active, eat normally and happy). He also urinate, farts and sleeps well. Is this normal? (Nonie) Answer: Hi Nonie, If your child is well and is drinking eating as usual – my question is- prior to this, how was his bowel habits? Is his stool soft or is it hard? Any history of straining at stool? If he is as u described, and the stool is soft, it is not worrying.

Question: Anak saya berumur 16 bulan. Sudah 2-3 bulan duburnya berdarah apabila dia buang air besar keras. Apabila najisnya keras , duburnya akan berdarah. Apakah cara yang baik untuk membanteras masalah ini? Dan apakah angkah-langkah pencegahan? (See Yee Hong) Answer: See Yee Hong , semestinya anak perlu berjumpa doktor agar rawatan boleh diberikan. Sekiranya dia sembelit sehingga duburnya berdarah , ini bermakna masalah ini sudah kronik dan telah lama berlarutan . Bawalah berjumpa doktor agar rawatan boleh dimulakan. Ubat air yang diberikan perlu diambil untuk beberapa minggu. Sementara itu, usaha untuk membaiki pemakanannya adalah penting. banyakkan fiber/serat dalam makanan . ini boleh didapati dalam buah dan sayur ataupun cereals. Banyak minum air. Susu formula jika diberikan perlu dikurangkan dan banyakkan makan . Jumpa pakar untuk rawatan agar ia tidak menjadi lebih teruk.

Question: Saya seorang ibu kepada dua org anak lelaki,yg pertama berumur 3 tahun++ yg no.2 berumur 8 bulan.. Masalah saya adalah anak yg pertama seringkali memukul,menolak,kadang2 memijak adiknya ketika meniarap,boleh saya katakan si abang suka membuli si adik… Saya jadi sangat risau tentang adiknya kerana badannya dan tulang yg masih lembut,buat masa ini adiknya tidak menunjukkan sebarang masalah.. Pada abang nya saya kadang sampai tidak tahan lalu memerahi dan memukul abangnya,bermacam cara saya cuba seperti yg di saran dalan berbagai blog,tetapi masih tidak membuahkan hasil… Abanh nya sangat lincah dan lasak,mungkin mcm budak hyperactive… Bagaimana caranya untuk saya mengurangkan masalah abangnya yg suka membuli adiknya dan bagaimana saya blh ubah abangnya? Harap doktor dapat membantu… Terima kasih.. (Pn. Ayu) Answer: Salam Pn Ayu, Adakah apa-apa keperluan emosi (emotional needs) si abang yang ibubapa belum penuhi? Masa bersamanya? Perhatian? Bermain bersamanya? Aktivi outdoor? Jika ada, penuhi keperluan emosi tersebut. Kanak-kanak yang berumur 3 tahun memang lasak. Lasak tidak semestinya hyperactive. Libatkan abang dalam aktiviti untuk menguruskan adik, beri tugasan seperti ambilkan diapers, pakaikan kasut dan sebagainya. Berikan abang rasa yang dia diperlukan. Adakah sesiapa yang dewasa dirumah yang suka berkasar/ memukul? Jika ada, hentikan, kerana abang akan meniru (modelling) kelakuan tersebut

Question: Salam doc..Anak saya berumur 2tahun 2bulan. Anak saya mpunyai masalah untuk membuang air besar setiap hari. Dalam sehari anak saya akan mbuang air besar dalam 3kali. Setiap kali anak saya nak meneran anak saya akan menangis. Kadang-kadang tu najis tak keluar pun. Kadang-kadang juga najis nya tidak lah sebanyak mana. Boleh dikatakan anak saya akan menangis setiap kali hendak mbuang air besar. Saya rasa kesian melihat anak saya meneran sambil menangis. Lagi satu, anak saya susah untuk makan nasi.hanya menyusu sahaja. Saya sebagai ibu jadi risau bila anak tak mahu makan. Bagi pandangan doc apa yg harus saya lakukan. (Nur Afiqah) Answer: Nur Afiqah , anak anda mengalami masalah sembelit dan perlukan rawatan. Rawatan ubat makan yang diberi untuk beberapa minggu dan pada yang sama habit pemakanan diperbaiki. Perlu minum banyak air, makan makanan yang banyak serat seperti buah dan sayur, kurangkan minum susu jika dia banyak minum susu formula. Tetapi rawatan doktor adalah perlu. Bawa anak berjumpa doktor.

Question: Anak saya baru sembuh dari tonsil yg membengkak dalam 4 mg yang lalu. Sekarang dia ada masalah gigi dan doktor menyarankan utk bius 100 % supaya boleh menjalankan pembedahan tersebut. Adakah ubat bius mendatangkan bahaya jika dilakukan juga selepas 4 minggu baru sembuh dari sakit tonsil. (Rubiah) Answer: Hi Rubiah , Sebelum sebarang pembedahan dilakukan , semua kanak-kanak dan orang dewasa akan diperiksa oleh pakar bius untuk memastikan bahawa pembedahan boleh dilakukan atau tidak. Ini bergantung pada tahap kesihatan anak pada waktu itu. Ubat bius secara amnya tidak mendatangkan masalah sekiranya dilakukan selepas tempoh tersebut sekiranya anak dikenalpasti ‘fit for surgery’.

Question: Assalamualaikum doktor, bayi perempuan saya berumur 5 bulan. Sejak dua minggu ini saya dapati ada lingkaran gelap terbentuk di bawah kelopak mata anak saya. Lingkaran gelap berkenaan semakin lama semakin jelas kelihatan. Ianya seperti orang dewasa yang tidak cukup tidur. Rutin tidur anak saya adalah dari jam 7 malam sehingga jam 7 pagi keesokannya. Selepas itu pada siang hari beliau akan berjaga selama sejam atau dua jam kemudian diselangi dengan tidur selama sejam atau dua jam sehingga petang. Adakah lingkaran gelap di bawah kelopak mata berkenaan petanda anak saya tidak cukup tidur? Ataupun itu adalah simptom untuk masalah kesihatan yang lain? Terima kasih atas bantuan doktor. (Zulkifli) Answer: Salam Zulkufli, Lingkaran gelap di bawah kelopak mata anak boleh berpunca daripada beberapa kemungkinan. Terdapat banyak saluran darah kecil di kawasan bawah kelopak mata kita. Berdasarkan warna kulit kita, warna kawasan ini boleh berbeza dari warna kemerahan sehingga warna merah gelap atau kehitaman. Keadaan ini boleh diwarisi juga. Seandainya ibubapa mempunyai lingkaran gelap ini, anak-anak juga boleh mewarisinya. Saluran darah ini juga besambungan dengan bahagian hidung. Dengan itu, ia juga berkaitan rapat dengan masalah jangkitan sinus hidung, allergi hidung atau resdung yang menyebabkan hidung sering tersumbat. Akan tetapi, sekiranya anak sihat dan tiada tanda lain selain daripada lingkaran gelap di bawah kelopak mata, encik tidak perlu risau. Jika anak mula menunjukkan tanda-tanda lain, sila bawa anak berjumpa doktor secepat yang mungkin untuk disiasat dan dirawat. Sekian terima kasih.

Question: Anak saya berumur setahun 3 bulan. Selepas 3 hari demam, doc perscribe Argumentine,setelah 8hari demam masih tak baik, doc masukkan ke dalam ward and tukarkn kepada rhocephine utk 7 hari. 4 hari anak saya dlm ward, lagi 3 hari saya harus ulang alik ke hospital utk bawa anak disuntik dengan rocephine. Alhamdulillah selepas dos yg terakhir, anak saya tidak demam lagi. Walaubagaimanapun, anak saya tidak mahu berjalan seperti selalu. Hanya mahu didokong sahaja.Anak saya akan menangis apabila disuruh berjalan. (Aqeela) Answer: Aqeela, dalam konteks begini adalah penting masalah ini diberitahu pada doktor yang telah merawat anak/ berjumpa doktor untuk pemeriksaan . Kami tidak dapat menasihati dengan lanjut tanpa memeriksa anak. Tidak berjalan terutama selepas sakit perlu diberi perhatian serius kerana tidak mahu terlepas sesuatu masalah yang lain.

Question: My boy is 9 months old, i found that he has lesser urine passing recently. His diaper is dry from 7pm until 12am..he drank 1-2 times milk around 4oz. But still dry diaper. But he still can pee normally while sleeping at nite. The urine color is pale yellow and he is active as usual. Appreciate your advise. Thanks (Jessie) Answer: Hi Jesse, is this a daily occurrence? As your child has started eating , he is likely to drink less than he did when he was less than 6 months old. It is expected that he passes urine if he drank 4 oz of milk . If he is well, active , passes a lot of urine at other times, no distended abdomen _ I would think that it is not worrying , HOWEVER , I would need to know how many times he drinks and passes urine in 24 hours. As much as I would like to reassure you , this is difficult without knowing the full details of his urine output frequency.
